content: p age | 1 offhand gloves by susan iding i m a bit of a planner and a lot of times i spend more time planning projects than actually knitting them this time however i thought i d just cast on and knit when i started cabling i had no idea where the cables were going i just let them go the worsted weight yarn is knit at a tight gauge to help keep the wind out and the soft fuzzy yarn feels so nice you might not want to take them off your hands gauge 25 st and 32 rounds = 4 inches in circular stockinette stitch skill beyond beginner yarn plymouth yarn suri merino paint 55% suri alpaca 45% extra fine merino 50 grams 109 yds color 8820 2 balls needles us#4 3 5mm dpns or circular needles whichever you prefer to knit in the round i find dpns helpful when picking up the stitches for the fingers use whatever size needles you need to make gauge supplies stitch markers extra yarn or stitch holders tapestry needle for weaving in ends sizes women s s m l size shown is size small finished hand circumference 7 7 5 8 inches special stitches left traveling cable sl1 to cn hold in back k2 p1 from cn right traveling cable sl2 to cn hold in fron p1 k2 from cn c2l sl2 to cn hold in front k2 k2 from cn c2b sl2 to cn hold in back k2 k2 from cn pattern notes these gloves can be knit in the round on dpns two circular needles or one long circular needle using the magic loop method i find it helpful to split the stitches exactly in half that way it is easier to visualize the palm and back of hand stitches and makes it easier to divide up the stitches for the fingers ©2009 susan iding for personal non-commercial use only p age | 2 left glove co 44 48 52 sts arrange stitches on 4 dpns 2 circular needles or one long needle using magic loop method into two halves join to work in round the first half of the stitches are the back-of-hand stitches and the second half are the palm stitches work k2 p2 rib for 20 rounds k2 4 6 work cable pattern according to chart knit remaining back of hand stitches and all palm stitches at row 8 of cable pattern begin thumb gusset work as set through st 43 47 51 pm m1 pm k1 next row work as set to marker slip marker m1 k1 m1 slip marker k1 there are now three new stitches between the markers work one row even repeat last two row until there are 15 17 19 stitches between the markers on last row slip the gusset stitches onto a spare length of yarn remove markers co one st using backward loop method and continue working the cable pattern palm stitches now have one more stitch than
